messages: 450443be80cec5189f89c56219105d41 (15:43): im looking for a general overview on how local storage works, and what its capabilities and limitations are
450443be80cec5189f89c56219105d41 (15:43): I'm trying to figure out if something is possible
450443be80cec5189f89c56219105d41 (15:45): view a website with multiple pages....     if user clicks a button "Save for Offline"    that particular page is now cached or saved in local storage
450443be80cec5189f89c56219105d41 (15:45): so the user can view it offline now
450443be80cec5189f89c56219105d41 (15:58): okay so i've done some reading and I think this might be doable
450443be80cec5189f89c56219105d41 (15:59): so to start with something basic im goign to try to save a webpage with some images into local storage ansd attempt to view it offline
923566ab723c9890cc637d7949124b7d (16:07): http://www.html5rocks.com/en/mobile/workingoffthegrid.html might be of help maybe?
450443be80cec5189f89c56219105d41 (16:07): I was going to read that after some other misc work
450443be80cec5189f89c56219105d41 (16:09): is this room typically this quiet?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (16:33): which app are you using for authoring SVG files?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (16:34): Inkscape is a bit sluggish, are there any alternatives besides Illustrator and SVGEdit?
11e7df4b7c3bd4f4ee7e76f4d3ba2fa8 (16:36): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6:  Not in my experience.  I use Illustrator.
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (16:36): 11e7df4b7c3bd4f4ee7e76f4d3ba2fa8: both Inkscape and Illustrator are generating awful code :/
11e7df4b7c3bd4f4ee7e76f4d3ba2fa8 (16:37): \nick bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8
11e7df4b7c3bd4f4ee7e76f4d3ba2fa8 (16:37): hmm
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (16:37): is there any hope that next release of Expression Design will support SVG?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (16:37): all browsers are supporting SVG now, but we have no tools
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (16:52): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: I'd say don't worry about the code.  Does SVG markup really need to be maintainable?
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (16:53): If SVG finally picks up steam, I'm sure the quality of the output will be prioritized in the future by tool vendors.
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (16:53): bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8: yes, it has if you are going to script it
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (16:55): I especially like the CSS code generated by Inkscape:
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (16:56): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: If you are going to script generated SVG?  Buzzah?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (16:57): bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8: one of the main purposes of SVG is scriptability
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (16:57): Right
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (16:58): bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8: it's not like HTML where you could code things manually. E.g. drawing a complex path would take a lot of time
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (16:58): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: yeah, unfortunately, I end up doing a lot of my SVG "drawing" by hand-coding
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (16:59): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: so do I, because authoring tools are generating mess
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (16:59): Right, so you export your mailbox or whatever from Illustrator and call it a day
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (16:59): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: are you aware of the Scour tool from JEff Schiller?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (16:59): that really helps clean up output from Inkscape or Illustator
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (16:59): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: is it SVG beautifier?
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (16:59): I find using compound paths generated in Illustrator to slot quite nicely into Rapha?´l
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (17:00): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: does it fix the coordinate system?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (17:00): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: more than  just a tidy tool
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (17:00): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: how do you mean?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (17:00): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Inkscape-generated groups have awkward transforms such as translate(-1878.682,-1983.51432)
8289720c65ae7948d98fb2bafa9f7834 (17:01): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6, note that there is an option somewhere within inkscape to restrict the number of decimals
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (17:01): yeah, that really sucks
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (17:01): it's more than just the float precision, 8289720c65ae7948d98fb2bafa9f7834
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (17:01): it does funky stuff with transforms, and with gradient chains, and all sorts of foulness
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (17:02): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: I don't recall if that made it into scour, but it should be able to be added
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (17:02): I've noticed that problem as well
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (17:03): it also sucks that both Inkscape and Illustrator are using custom renderers
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (17:03): paul_irish_: i think the html5shiv is final.
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (17:03): which are far behind WebKit in standards compliance
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (17:03): paul_irish_: unless there's something else you or remy want before plugging it in to your own repos.
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (17:17): Switched my IRC client from Adium to http://webchat.freenode.net/
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (17:17): I imagine it does not leverage the Notifications API, but we'll see how it goes anyway
e322891413e2b93d92810930491a9b57 (17:24): bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8: switch to http://quassel-irc.org/
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (17:37): e322891413e2b93d92810930491a9b57: I was happy with Adium, but I wanted to switch to a standards-based client
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (17:37): I'm trying to eventually switch similarly for all applications
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (17:40): However, I haven't been very successful‚Ä¶ working on FTP, SVN, and even Git projects are all better experiences outside of the browser
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (17:41): The same goes for Photoshop, and coding (Cloud9 IDE has a fine editor, but other huge problems)
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (17:54): hello!
